topic: Niche characterization
application: SDMs for conservation planning and restoration
niche.measurement: Field data plus WorldClim

topic: Niche characterization
application: SDMs with climate change and restoration
niche.measurement: Field surveys on shrubs, their sociability traits, a PCA to select species, and then MaxEnt on selected desired shrubs, with WorldClim and scenario 2 climate change

topic: Niche partioning and interactions
niche.measurement: Depth gradient and models of niche overlap

topic: Niche changes over ontogeny and inter-specific facilitation
application: Coexistence and rare endangered species conservation
niche.measurement: Seedling monitoring at different microsites, and spatial association

topic: Environmental niche: shade and rainfall of four shrubs
application: Plant recruitment with climate change implications
niche.measurement: Field experiment manipulating shade and rainfall on seedlings

topic: Coexistence in grass-shrub steppes
niche.measurement: Modeling with confirmation from empirical data

topic: Niche differentiation/segregation in a shrubland
niche.measurement: Multi-scale analysis of shrub-understory relationships using perennials and their traits

topic: Niche partioning in tree-grass interactions
niche.measurement: Precipitation manipulations to estimate water distribution in the soil profile in relation shrub and grasses use

topic: Niche partioning among shrub-annuals and biological crusts
niche.measurement: Field surveys on shrubs using quadrats and coexistence models

topic: Regeneration niche of six shrubs using one-week-old seedlings
niche.measurement: Field experiment manipulating shade and rainfall, measuring survival over 22 weeks and traits

topic: Opposing effects on interactions (increased phylogenetic dispersion) and environment (clustered PD) in determing phylogenetic patterns
niche.measurement: Vegetation surveys combined with climate models and phylogenetic structure metrics. Co-occurrence models also used

topic: Different regeneration niches according to nurse requirement are functionally different
niche.measurement: Greenhouse and field experiments on 20-54 shrub species (respectively) to estimate their traits

topic: Phenology studies on leaf deployment using NDVI between grasses and trees in relation to temperature
niche.measurement: Remote sesing on satellite imagery to estimate phenological mismatch

topic: Niche differentiation in relation to tree-grass interactions and herbivory/substrate
niche.measurement: Greenhouse experiment manipulating competition, substrate and herbivory (clipping)

topic: Direct and indirect effects (niche segregation) in shrub-understory systems
niche.measurement: Vegetation surveys combined with climate models and phylogenetic structure metrics. Co-occurrence models also used

topic: Niche partioning through time
expansion mechanism: Spatiotemporal niche (spatial partioning changing through time)
niche.measurement: Vegetation surveys over time with spatially explicit stats. Removals at the beginnng

topic: Niche differentiation during ontogeny
niche.measurement: Several techniques from transplants, spatial patterns and biochemical assays

topic: Facilitation to competition change alters phylogenetic structure of the community
application: Coexistence and assembly over time. Network stability and invasion
niche.measurement: Field surveys on shrubs/cacti combined with network and phylogenetic analyses

topic: Regeneration niche in a stress gradient over 5 years (self-facilitation)
niche.measurement: Transplant experiment monitored over 5 years with seeds from different procedence and planted in a stress gradient

topic: Niche segregation between shrub and grass communities and how these are different, als o in relation to fire disturbance
niche.measurement: Field surveys in both communties with env variables and multivariate stats

topic: Phylogenetic distance predicts balance of interactions, where more related species compete more
niche.measurement: Phylogenetic distances on surveys of spatial association with 3 nurse communities

topic: Temporal (ontogenic) shift from facilitation to competition
niche.measurement: Census on tagged Ambrosia individuals very 5 years for 10 years. 4 clases: open/shrub, and clumped/isolated

topic: Quaternary nurses facilitate tertiary species
expansion mechanism: Temporal niche (regeneration niche over geological eras)
niche.measurement: Large dataset (mediterranean) and field determination (Mexico) of nurse syndromes and Quaternary/Tertiary origins

topic: Shrubs provide safe sites for herbs under herbivory
niche.measurement: Herbivore exclusion and monitoring of plants growing in open and understory microsite, over a 7 year experimennt

topic: Regeneration niche of a shrub is preferably found in open microsites, not related to the canopy of Artemisia tridentata
niche.measurement: Field experiment manipulating water to predicted climate change levels and planting seedling in open/understory microsites

topic: Regeneration niche analysis of 8 species, showing some of them required nurses while others did not
niche.measurement: Biotic and abiotic characteristics measured using surveys on naturally occurring seedlings
beneficiary: All of the previous as seedlings

topic: Rainfall effects on the regeneration niche of Q. emoryi
niche.measurement: Field experiment manipulating rainfall with measures of survival, biomass, growth and size

topic: Spatiotemporal niche, spatial patterns between species change with ontogeny
expansion mechanism: Spatiotemporal niche (spatial partioning changing through time)
niche.measurement: One 100mx20 m plot was mapped and analyzed with spatial stats using size classes for shrubs

topic: Spatial niche (hydrological) of 3 shrubs and a grass as they use water in coexistence
niche.measurement: Watering experiments and monitoring of its use by the target species (water potential, root elongation)
